comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This one is fun - the 'Miranda' was evidently a well-known racing yacht built in 1887 for John Henry Want, a colourful yachting identity (!). I think that is him sitting at left, the proud owner. See article about the new yacht in ATCJ 15/10/1887 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/71090170 The dry dock looks to have iron (not stone) side walls - I wonder if it was the Jubilee Dock or something similar?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: J. H. Want sold the 'Miranda' to Mr Burford of South Australia in 1894 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13977697 So this photo is likely to be 1887-1894. The gent's clothes looks right, if a bit over-dressed for messing around in boats. 'Miranda' destroyed by fire in SA 1922 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/49130890

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Aha! This article describes gentlemen yachties attending the launch of the 'Era' and then inspecting the new 'Miranda' in Rountrees Dock (another floating dock in Balmain), which might explain the fine clothes - SMH 6/12/1887 p.9 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13670808 [The 'Miranda' was also in Rountrees Dock, Balmain in October 1889 for thorough cleaning - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13746879 . Strikes me that the knobs would not have dressed up to go and see this occasion!] So possibly 5 December 1887, a Monday.
